comments.body: Perhaps this biome could include very large and incredibly twisted trees, and odd-looking fungi. This biome could have been a combination of the crimson and warped forests, and as such be inherently weird and corrupted. By this I mean a toxic and unnatural looking biome.
violet fungi? maybe change the name from violet to somethin else

I was just about to suggest the idea, but I found this instead. My idea was to make the Violet Forest a kind of "haunted" biome that has undead mobs such as phantoms, skeletons, wither skeletons, and zombified piglins. Living mobs don't actually spawn within.
I like your idea of a violet forest biome, however it should be an extremely rare biome akin to jungles edge that appears between a crimson and warped forest.

This could be a great chance to add one or two new mobs and structures,

And who knows,

Maybe the plants could grow sideways and upside down here as well?

Maybe change it from Violet to somethin' more eloquent?

 

Just an idea...
We can do a new boss, e.g.: ancient spirits, they would drop ancient debris, so they would have 50 hearts of health, and they would summon spirit helpers, they would spawn in the violet forest

Since they just added nether gold ore in the new snapshot, perhaps nether gold is just more common in this biome.

I think it would be better to keep it as just a variant of crimson forest. All the acid stuff seems way outside a vanilla experience.

The acid part doesn't seem like it would fit into the game. But the idea of a yellow netherwart forest sounds nice. Having a forest for all 3 primary colors. And since both the crimson and warped forests now have vines, maybe this can have the sideways growing vines that some people have been talking about.
Maybe instead of dropping ingots you could collect the sap in glass bottles, and then cool it off in the overworld using water.
I don't think the acid fits into Vanilla at all, but a yellow netherwart forest seems interesting. It could also be called the "Golden Forest"
A variant of the soulsand canyon filled with crying obsidian boulders would definitely be interesting. You have my vote!
It should have Crying Obsidian spires not boulders. Jagged spires emerging from the floor and celling.

To readers: feel free to suggest improvements, structures, mobs, etc. This is just an idea I had that might make a good outline for a biome. If it is implemented, it will likely be very different from my suggestion, so feel free to post tweaks and potential features in the comments section and your own posts!

I wouldn't mind if that aspect was removed if this was implemented. I added it because I wanted an extra danger to be constantly present. The majority of mobs would have worse visibility and slower speed just like the player, but the hunger would be able to follow them anywhere! I do agree that it could get annoying, though.
Clarification: my last post was a response to a request to remove the hunger drain.
Honestly, I agree
I love this.
I like the name "Soul Sand Valley"

If not Shrieking Valley, they could definitely go with something like "Desert of the Dead" or "Basin of Souls."

I don't mind the name "Soul Sand Valley," but you're right that it's pretty uninspired.

I actually think "Soul Valley" would be the best name for the biome. Removing the word "sand" acknowledges the presence of soul soil, and makes the title less unwieldy. Not terribly exciting or dramatic, but biome names don't need to be. They just need to be adequately descriptive.
This is a great idea!
Well done this is now a thingüòÄ

What about round world generation? Instead of generating new world, game could just load chunks behind me. I think it could be very interesting. Your world will be somehow limited. I think that there definitelly are some challanges surrounding it, but you are smart guys. You should figure it out :D

Thanks for an absolutely awesome game btw
CAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAT
I'm sorry but this will likely not be in Minecraft Vanilla. It sounds like a mod.
As much as I like cats, I don't think this should be implemented into the game.  However, a map like this would be AMAZING.
this seems ridicoulis
I love it bc i love cats
Cat
This is a great idea in my opinion. Very creative and I feel needs to be done in some way
I remember making this suggestion in several places and everyone made fun of me. Now I see I'm not the only one.
please comment stucteres related
Please read this post by WolveReigner781 to understand how to write a proper proposal for something as huge as a new dimension. Thank you.
Love the idea

I think this is a great idea. It reminds me alot of the origin island from the biomes o plenty mod. However to avoid copying that mod i would suggest new and rare structures that only spawn in these biomes. Aswell as a few new features.
Well come my worlds
yeah, it has a few new plants but you cant really call it a garden if it has no flowers or ferns

I was thinking about something a few days ago and I found that it lacked hostile plants.
For example, one or two carnivorous plants. At least one could eat insects like bees, I also saw people mention fireflies that would give a better atmosphere to the biome.
For the player, one of the carnivorous plants could simply catch it and slow it down a little or something else. Some carnivorous plants in real life close if you touch them even if they are too small to do anything, it would be a similar effect here.

Their textures would be adapted to this biome (or maybe each biome they are), making them less easy to see.
Players will be able to pick them up like flowers and use them for decoration or for a little defense even if limited. For example, simply slow down monsters, pillagers or players.

One of the hostile plants could have a more friendly appearance to attract an insect or maybe even the player. I don‚Äôt know what it might look like but maybe it could have a very similar shape to another plant or object. This makes think of the trapped chest which is recognizable only by its red mark.

It would also be interesting to have a completely unique type of carnivorous plant, fully adopting the game's own identity.
White and grey pumpkins, a rare corpse flower, white rose bushes, a hostile plant... Several fitting ideas for a garden biome.

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

Title: ‚ÄúNew Dimension 1.20‚Äù  

Text: ‚ÄúThe dimension found within the ender pearl, with a new boss , that the dimension is like the end and is full of endermites.‚Äù 

- Translated by Admin
Tambi√©n se podr√≠an poner champi√±ones peque√±os que sean muy parecidos de color a los endermitas y que tengan vida

It should have its variant of existing trees but with each colored autumn leaves & with saplings so the leaves are renewable. This would be a great time to also add a new tree type in general. This alone would hugely impact foliage builds. And why not also have other autumn biomes, like the autumn plains & autumn birch forests? It would bring so much more life into MC.

Yes! Would love to see waves in minecraft, and washing up items would also be cool, but maybe in the form of a seaweed block? Like a carpet/floor vine that when you break it it has a chance to drop a valuable item? Silk touch or shears could get seaweed?
And they could add surfboards

I like the idea of waves/tides/currents, however, I can think of only 1 way to implement them without breaking the feel of the game...

1. Tides: it would be cool if the water height of naturally generating water (maybe only within 5 blocks of the sea level) would lower by 1/4 of a block, and then go back up... if it actually moved blocks, it would be disastrous for some builds...

2. Waves/currents: unless there was a block regulating them (like a bubble column) it would (once again) break certain builds (unless it only affects natural water?) that being said, if rivers/oceans gained waves during a storm & currents during a heavy storm, it could be verry interesting...
I love The idea!! IT could also add Palms, coconuts and crabs in coconut shells also maybe wet Sand!

I think a respawn thing for the end should be unique like the respawn anchor but a source of wood would be nice. A outpost in the end could supply this. A lightsource is already in the end in the form of end rods. As far as a tamable mob it could be a mount that allows you to go a short distance over the void. The new achievement idea would be great.

Love it! Have always wanted an end update and bringing new colour and interest could make it a much better place to live and gather resources. Naturally spawning water and trees in the end would be wonderful, although purpur and chorus plants seem to act as end trees already. It would be great to have some sort of 'giant chorus plant' that you could get wood from though!
You know, this is just what Minecraft needs! And maybe the Red Dragon!
it could be a specials smaller dripstone cave with some lets say ...   secrets
I was going to suggest that too. I like the idea very much. Bats are so boring right now, if there were lots of them, they would at least make it harder to hit mobs with a bow in the cave.
There should be mountains of bat droppings, like in real life. You should be able to use these droppings as really good fertilizer!
Please just make bats more interesting.

With dripstone inside the cave, and when making a lot of noise they fly out
With dripstone inside the cave, and when making a lot of noise they fly out
todo es buena idea exepto la cueva con excremento de murcielago. seria muy asqueroso

the biome looks interesting but something is missing

Why would players enter the biome? for thread?
Incrible
It could have something like buried treasure and the loot in the dungeons good be better like an increased chance for a enchanted apple,and a even rare chance for a skull
Maybe there could also be new types of spiders to go with it
That would be incredible!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I like this idea! However, farlands is interesting enough on its own. If anything, I would prefer it had no mobs at all- giving it a eerie feeling like you aren‚Äôt supposed to be there. The intrigue lies within the landscape itself- rather than adding mobs for it, I would consider atmospheric / ambience to enhance it. Adding mobs feel like it would detract from its mystery.
This is a great idea! I'm not sure about adding mobs there but I would love if it appeared above the nether roof near world border or somewhere at The End and had a achievement for reaching there
Could their be black/withered/wither fossils

maybe there could be wither trees that grow in the biome that drop withered apples that can be eaten and would give you wither effect as well as can be brewed into potion of wither and the tree would give dark grey /black wood though when it grows and netheracck around it turns into withered netherack and nothing else can grow on it
A withered bone block sounds cool.
So amazing
This sounds like a good idea!  I always thought beaches were boring in Minecraft.  This will make beaches more realistic, and thus more fun to explore.
This is a really good idea. They should add other things like palm trees too to make beaches look more realistic.
